inferno-king-grimm.name: Inferno King Grimm
inferno-king-grimm.description: Inferno King Grimm is the first mod I made for Hollow Knight. It takes the existing Nightmare King Grimm bossfight changes it up significantly</br></br>It does so by spliting the fight into 3 distinct phases, each harder than the last. Not only are the existing moves modified to be harder, but two other new moves were introduced, a ground slam attack, and a move where grimm shows up in the middle of the arena and spawns tons of fireballs.</br></br>The boss has two difficulty modes, a normal mode that anyone is able to play, and a hard mode geared towards experts. The setting can be changed on the main menu of the game. Other customization options include custom health values, disabling camera color effects, and enabling a permanent blue camera filter

corrupted-kin.name: Corrupted Kin
corrupted-kin.description: Corrupted Kin is the second mod I made for Hollow Knight. It takes the existing Lost Kin bossfight and changes it up significantly and adds a bunch of new moves</br></br>The fight is split up into two very distinct phases, with the first phases being very similar to the original Lost Kin fight, but with a new bomb lob move and adjustments to the existing move. The second phases, however, is when an entire wave system is brought into the mix as an obstacle the player must avoid. The boss can control the waves at will by slamming into the ground or by other means. There are also 2 times during the 2nd phase where the boss will jump into the ceiling and will unlease 3 of 5 random attacks on the player.</br></br>Overall, I find this to be my favorite modded boss that I designed, since it uses a wave system I built entirely from scratch

badland-battles.name: Badland Battles
badland-battles.description: Badland battles is a top-down shooting game made for a college course. It's a simple game where you play as a soldier in the middle of a desert arena, and your goal is to defeat the onslaught of enemy troops. There are different types of guns you can equip, and there are kits for refilling your ammo and health. This demo game is designed to test out some of the more advanced features of Unity, features that include:</br>- Playing Mixamo Animations using the Mechanim system</br>- Using root motion for the imported animations</br>- Using baked lights, probes, and reflections so the lighting does not need to be calculated in realtime</br>- Use of particle effects</br>- Using both spatial and non-spatial audio sources</br>- Freezing time when the game is paused</br>- Using the Nav-Mesh system to allow the enemies to walk towards the player and avoid obstacles

nitro.name: Nitro
nitro.description: Nitro is a library that makes it easier to create custom powerups for your game. Whether it be a racing game, an RPG game, or any game you want. It also has support for having combinable powerups, where two or more different powerups can have their abilities combined for a more powerful effect. The download link below contains a demo of how combinable powerups can be utilized. View the Wiki page for a tutorial on how to get started

mega-muncher.name: Mega Muncher
mega-muncher.description:
Mega Muncher is a game similar to pac-man, made as a final project for a college class. It was made over the course of a few days using the Unity Engine. One of the key things about this project is that it was made using Unity's tilemap system, which allowed me to very easily build the levels. It's essentially a painting tool used for placing tiles along a grid.

All other graphics were made by me

ultimate-asteroid-tactical-control.name: Ultimate Asteroid Tactical Control
ultimate-asteroid-tactical-control.description:
Ultimate Asteroid Tactical Control (UAT), is a simple asteroid game where you pilot a space ship and shoot down asteroids. It was one of the first projects I have done for a game programming class at college, and was mean't to show the basics of using Unity, such as Sprites, Rigidbodies and Instantiation. It also shows off a parallax effect on the background, where multiple different background elements move at different rates to give the illusion of depth

uatanks.name: UATanks
uatanks.description:
UATanks is a top-down tank shooting game, where your goal is to control a tank in an arena and destroy all the other tanks to win. It is one of the larger projects I have made during college, and is used to demonstrate features such as:
- Having each tank have a different "personality", by giving each type of a tank a different AI
- An options menu for changing key settings for the game
- Having a multitude of different powerups and effects
- A mini-map for knowing where everything is located
- A map that is procedurally generated
- Splitscreen multiplayer
- A highscore system
- Saving option settings to disk via PlayerPrefs
